data.title: CNC balance 0420
Don't crash d2k when shooting at aircraft and don't hard-code the sprite in smoke trails.
Start moving towards saner RA widget logic
data.body:
- Let the shellmaps open the main menu. This lets us not hardcode MAINMENU_BG everywhere.
- Unshellmapify all the D2k MP maps and have a real shellmap. This shellmap doesn't actually do anything but it doesn't make the current D2k shellmap situation worse.
- Swaps to the observer widgets after gameover so you have access to the shroud selector, observer radar and player stats. Fixes #2522 and removes massive duplication
- This also lets us remove the legacy OpenWidgetAtGameStart trait in favour of LoadWidgetAtGameStart.

data.title: avoid spurious re-indexing of maps just prior to shellmap load
Mechanic uses red-cross heal cursor
data.body: should not be hard-coded to suit the medic only and use a small wrench icon for our redneck friend.

data.title: Per tileset configurable selection overlays
data.body: Don't use a white one for more contrast on snow, closes #2050.

data.title: Survival01 crashes after recent shroud refactor

data.title: Be more verbose about missing sequences and files
data.body: as requested in #3039 although it does not solve all problems. The design decision to keep sequence definitions separate from game rules might be appealing for mods which have them all set up correctly, but modders usually forget about them when adding new unit rules. Now they get a warning immediately on startup that something will go wrong when the asset is loaded so that you don't have to click through the build palette and test build every unit to check for related crashes.

data.title: Added .mix filename to Exception if duplicate values are found
Fix Fragile Alliance button usability and Diplomacy Shroud problems
fix NullReferenceException when watching replays with team chat
Cruisers no longer jump in with Chronosphere in RA temperate shellmap
Disallow modifiers on the chrome palette
data.body: which fixes #3123 when the build palette cycles on RA desert maps.

data.title: Don't try to return to base if already dead
Desert maps have bogus palette cycling on the build palette
Demotruck attack does not flash target
Unlag
Goodbye classic mods
data.body:
The community around http://cnc-comm.com/ is [hostile](http://i.imgur.com/zPZDSVG.jpg). No one cared for the classic mods. They are also redundant and waste developer time, mostly @pchote during his refactors to add Tiberian Sun support.
- Created https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/FAQ#this-is-not-true-to-the-original which will redirect them to the more popular http://cncnet.org/ and http://redalert1.com site.
- Will send deletion request for http://www.moddb.com/mods/openra-classic
- Just closed our TODO list at #2740 and will do the same with all related feature requests.

You can still send a patch if you want to maintain it again. Probably also remove all the redundancy in the yaml rules and inherit more from the ra/cnc mods to succeed.

data.title: Compress the mods/ra/bits folder a bit
data.body:
I created
- aftermath.mix which contains parts of EXPAND2.MIX but stripped down
- counterstrike.mix which is EXPAND(2).MIX but cleaned up, too

As Harissons RA desert and temperat terrain expansion seem finished I put everything into:
- desert.mix
- temperat-expansion.mix
  to clean up.

data.title: updated map slippery_slopes (supports 8 players)
move autotarget scan time params into AutoTargetInfo
Orca nerf: reducing damage vs. heavy 20 dmg -> 15
data.body:
Orca rockets will do 15 damage vs. heavy. Hopefully this will take some edge off orca spam. This will:
-Give anti-air APC more lasting power vs. orca, ensuring it can at least down some of them and get their money's worth.
-Mammoth tank will bet better able to survive a mass assault and return fire with its rockets to down some of them (and get better money's worth).
-Give advanced guard towers better ability to defend themselves against air assault. (ATWR has heavy armor and does good damage, but can die quickly against a large group of orcas).
-Give armored units in general more resilience vs. orcas so they aren't completely helpless and quickly annihilated. Maybe then they can reach their target better (e.g. a couple tanks charging an artillery position that is being defended by some orcas).

Damage vs. infantry also slightly reduced as as result (also 20 -> 15 dmg).
Orcas generally aren't a threat to infantry, but E3s should be able to do some credible damage, even if they are in a small group. Enough orca spam will kill a small group of infantry, unfortunately. Since Orca has no business attacking infantry anyway, this slight nerf won't hurt orcas.

(Note: The damage model was simplified a bit, so that it does 100% of 30 dmg instead of 75% of 40 damage, vs. light & wood.)

data.title: Implementation of MRJ
Translucent effects
data.body: Currently the explosion and flame sprites from Dune 2000 look bad because the translucent bits are just black instead of see-through.

data.title: tesla lock on to cloaked unit error
data.body:
If your enemy has a sniper, tesla tries to kill it while reloading (tesla locked/aimed on sniper), and sniper cloaks again -> Tesla keeps locked on sniper and does not try to shoot at other things. If you click on the tesla you can see the red aiming line, means you know where the sniper is, and force kill it with ctrl. 
Tesla should search for another target instead of waiting until sniper uncloaks itself. 
Reproducible. 
http://i.imgur.com/CkqLY40.jpg

data.title: Red Alert building artwork polishing
data.body:
This fixes #2660 and adds [Red Alert Building Husks](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=16100) made by Harisson and other unpublished artwork he labeled as _[OpenRa]Red Alert eX.png_ in the e-Mail he sent me:
- [smoother weapon factory Door animation](http://content.open-ra.org/?p=detail&table=units&id=306)
- [more ore silo fill steps](http://content.open-ra.org/?p=detail&table=units&id=305)

![building-husks](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/401481/15e2643a-a8dc-11e2-8e12-3e20bcbc4313.png)

data.title: Fixes #3104
updated map, dead in motion (redux)
D2K--QuadRockets and Bazooka are no longer "high"
data.body:
Quad spam can be potentially very powerful. Gameplay-wise, one should be able to avoid their powerful missiles by hiding behind a building or a wall.
It doesn't necessarily make much sense that a vehicle low to the ground should be able to shoot over things perfectly. Same for infantry. 
The advantage of shooting high should be reserved for units like artillery, so you can put them behind walls or other obstacles. Makes gameplay more interesting and dynamic. 

TowerRockets will stay high.
